greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, a(p) = p mod 4 for p prime and a(u * v) = a(u) * a(v) for u, v > 0.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) = if n = 1 then 1 else (A020639(n) mod 4) * n / A020639(n).
Dirichlet g.f.: 1/(1-2^(-s+1)) * prod(prime p=4k+1, 1/(1-p^(-s)) * prod(prime p=4k+3, 1/(1-3*p^(-s)). - _Ralf Stephan_, Mar 28 2015
mathematica: a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Mod[p = FactorInteger[n][[1, 1]], 4]*a[n/p]; Table[ a[n], {n, 1, 100} ] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 20 2012 *)
program: a065338 n = (spf `mod` 4) * a065338 (n `div` spf) where spf = a020639 n
(PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n)); prod(i=1,#f~, (f[i,1]%4)^f[i,2]) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 07 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 29 2001
